The Annex Basement Waterproofing Specialists

Heritage waterproofing for Victorian & Edwardian homes

The Annex's century-old Victorian and Edwardian homes require specialized waterproofing that respects historical integrity while meeting modern living demands. Our heritage-trained team understands stone foundations, shallow basements, and the unique challenges of Toronto's most architecturally significant neighborhood.

Heritage Foundation Specialists

The Annex's Victorian stone foundations require specialized expertise. Our team understands heritage requirements and preserves character while providing modern protection.

Annex Heritage Waterproofing FAQ

Can you waterproof without damaging heritage features?

Yes! We specialize in heritage properties using interior systems that protect foundations without affecting exterior appearance. When exterior work is needed, we use reversible methods that preserve historical character.

Do stone foundations need different waterproofing?

Absolutely. Victorian stone foundations require breathable solutions with specialized mortars and sealers. Our systems are designed specifically for historical masonry while preventing liquid water entry.

What about heritage permit requirements?

We handle all heritage permit applications for Annex properties, working with Heritage Preservation Services and understanding their requirements for smooth approvals.

Can you work around university schedules?

Yes! We coordinate with U of T schedules, understanding exam periods and special events. Many professors and staff are our clients, and we respect academic neighborhood needs.
